conclusion: Analyze forces using Newton's second law.
Horizontal pulling force F is applied to block B; spring between blocks B and C exerts force Fs; static friction acts on block D.
Surface is smooth, no friction between blocks and surface; all blocks accelerate with same acceleration a.
Total mass of system is 4m; applying Newton's second law: F = 4ma; acceleration a = F/4m.
Block D influenced by static friction force fs from block C; fs responsible for acceleration of block D.
Applying Newton's second law to block D: fs = ma; substituting a: fs = m(F/4m) = F/4.
Magnitude of static friction force acting on block D is F/4.
